meanings.sent1: The poor cat looked mawky with its droopy eyes.
meanings.sent2: She felt mawky after staying up all night studying.
meanings.sent3: The mawky plant seemed to be asking for extra care.
meanings.sent4: The room had a mawky atmosphere, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The mawky sky foretold an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Having a foul or unpleasant taste or smell
meanings.sent1: The mawky soup made everyone wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent2: The garbage bin emitted a mawky odor that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent3: The mawky cheese was accidentally left out in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The alley had a mawky stench that made passersby hurry past.
meanings.sent5: The mawky fish left a distasteful aftertaste in his mouth.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of illness or disease
meanings.sent1: His mawky complexion raised concerns among his friends.
meanings.sent2: The mawky patient was immediately taken to the hospital.
meanings.sent3: The mawky symptoms disappeared after taking the prescribed medicine.
meanings.sent4: The mawky appearance of the fruit hinted at a possible infestation.
meanings.sent5: The mawky cough echoed through the quiet room.
